newsitem.title: USA: Mustang Software says to reduce workforce.
newsitem.headline: Mustang Software says to reduce workforce.

text.p: Mustang Software Inc said it will reduce its workforce in a restructuring to improve operating efficiency and reduce costs.
The amount of job reductions was not immediately known.

Under the restructuring, James Harrer, president and chief executive officer, will assume responsibility for all operating aspects of the company, including marketing the company's Wildcat! Interactive Net Server (WIN Server), following the resignation of Richard Heming, vice president, chief operating officer, who is leaving to pursue other interests. Heming, a company founder, will remain a director.

Brett Martin, vice president of sales and marketing, also resigned from the company. In addition, other positions throughout the company have been consolidated in order to improve financial performance, it said.
Harrer also indicated that, due to recent declines in Mustang's stock price, he was being forced to sell a portion of his Mustang common stock to pay off a margin loan.

About 15,000 shares were sold by Harrer in October 1996, and subsequently additional shares will be sold to satisfy the loan. The number of additional shares to be sold will depend on share price levels. Heming is also expected to be required to sell a portion of his stock to satisfy his margin loans.
